images.caption: Leopard Gecko
images.caption_text: Crazy, adorable, clumsy, and absolutely lovable reptiles.

images.caption: Hypomelanistic Carrot-Tail Baldy
images.caption_text: Largely yellow that turns to splotches of ornage at tail base then white with scattered spots.

images.caption: RAPTOR
images.caption_text: A large acronym for this strain of leopard gecko, no doubt.

images.caption: Trempor
images.caption_text: They were the first strain of albino Leopard Gecko discovered, and are also the most common of the albinos.

images.caption: Tangerine Tornado
images.caption_text: Developed in Canada by The Urban Gecko, exhibits large amounts of red pigment on the head

images.caption: G-Project
images.caption_text: The “G Project” started in 2006 with the quest to make “greener” looking leopard geckos. By SaSoBek Reptiles.

images.caption: Hypomelanistic Carrot-Tail Baldy
images.caption_text: Largely yellow that turns to splotches of ornage at tail base then white with scattered spots.

images.caption: TUG Snow
images.caption_text: They were the first strain of albino Leopard Gecko discovered, and are also the most common of the albinos.
